poem:
"Electricity In Absentia"

From darkened Kherson, a prayer echoes. 
War's unlit labyrinth, treacherous and rife.
Muddled in mortal strife.
Yet, there within Moscow and Delhi's shadows,
Declare Lavrov, Jaishankar, even Putin,
A frayed thread, a promise woven, unforgotten.
Seek the light not in conference halls,
But in the human constellation,
Electricity pulses through each threadbare connection.
prompt: You are the poet Tracy K. Smith. You woke up this morning feeling joyful. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war live: majority of Kherson without electricity due to shelling, says governor 2.33pm GMT Putin likely to meet Modi next year, says Indian minister Following talks held earlier in Moscow between the Russian foreign minister, Sergei Lavrov and his Indian counterpart, Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, Putin will also meet with the external affairs minister of India today, said a Kremlin spokesperson. Speaking at a news conference alongside Lavrov, Jaishankar said he expected Russian president, Vladimir Putin". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russia-Ukraine war live: majority of Kherson without electricity due to shelling, says governor 2.33pm GMT Putin likely to meet Modi next year, says Indian minister Following talks held earlier in Moscow between the Russian foreign minister, Sergei Lavrov and his Indian counterpart, Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, Putin will also meet with the external affairs minister of India today, said a Kremlin spokesperson. Speaking at a news conference alongside Lavrov, Jaishankar said he expected Russian president, Vladimir Putin
